item.title: Guilty Of The Festive Binge? Try These 10 Ways To Detox In The New Year - Slurrp
item.description:
Guilty Of The Festive Binge? Try These 10 Ways To Detox In The New Year

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Slurrp

The festive season often leads to overindulgence, leaving us bloated and lethargic. A thoughtful detox can help restore balance and rejuvenate your body. Here are effective ways to detox after the festive binge.

  • Hydrate adequately with water and herbal teas.
  • Incorporate fresh fruits, vegetables, and whole grains into your meals.
  • Engage in gentle exercises like yoga or walking.
  • Prioritize quality sleep to aid detoxification.
  • Avoid processed foods and limit caffeine and alcohol.
  • Practice mindful eating habits.
  • Focus on whole, plant-based foods for nourishment.
  • Include detoxifying beverages in your diet.
  • Engage in regular physical activity to boost detox processes.
  • Prioritize gut health with probiotics and prebiotics.
"Detoxing helps reset your system, restore energy levels, and improve overall health." - Article Source

This detox period is a chance for rejuvenation. By nourishing your body and being mindful of your habits, you can regain vitality and embrace the New Year positively.

item.title: Ageing fine: 10 healthy meal planning tips for better health, nutrition - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Ageing fine: 10 healthy meal planning tips for better health, nutrition

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

This article provides ten essential meal planning tips to help individuals maintain better health and nutrition as they age.

  • Enjoy diverse foods to minimise disease risks like diabetes and hypertension with colourful fruits and vegetables.
  • Prioritise protein-rich foods to maintain muscle strength.
  • Include fruits and vegetables in meals and snacks for fiber and vitamins.
  • Ensure adequate B12 intake through fortified foods or supplements.
  • Season meals with herbs and citrus instead of salt to reduce sodium.
  • Opt for unsaturated fats like olive oil or avocados over saturated fats.
  • Stay hydrated to support digestion and nutrient absorption.
  • Choose whole grains for sustained energy and fiber.
  • Include calcium-rich foods like dairy or fortified non-dairy products.
  • Maintain appropriate portion sizes to manage calorie intake.

item.title: 9 mental health habits you should adopt for a healthier 2025 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
9 Mental Health Habits You Should Adopt Now for a Healthier 2025

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

This article outlines essential mental health habits to incorporate now to improve well-being by 2025.

  • Exercise: A 30-minute daily walk can reduce anxiety and promote good sleep by releasing endorphins.
  • Proper Sleep: Consistently sticking to a sleep schedule can help manage stress and anxiety.
  • Drink Water: Staying hydrated boosts focus, reduces fatigue, and supports brain health.
  • Nutritious Meals: A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and proteins supports cognitive health.
  • Limit Caffeine and Alcohol: Moderation is key for mental health and wellness.
  • Relax: Practices like meditation and breathing exercises help reduce stress.
  • Set Goals: Setting achievable goals can help manage daily stress and prevent overwhelm.
  • Meet Family and Friends: Maintaining relationships provides emotional support and reduces feelings of isolation.
  • Gratitude: Writing down things you're grateful for can shift focus from stress to positivity.
“Gratitude shifts your focus from stress to positivity.”

In conclusion, adopting these mental health habits can pave the way for a healthier and happier 2025.

item.title: 10 health benefits of dark chocolate that will surprise you - Moneycontrol
item.description:
10 health benefits of dark chocolate that will surprise you

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Moneycontrol

Dark chocolate is packed with powerful benefits. From improving heart health to managing weight, it’s good for your well-being.

  • Improves blood flow and lowers blood pressure.
  • Boosts insulin sensitivity, aiding in diabetes prevention.
  • Provides antioxidant protection, neutralizing free radicals.
  • Enhances cognitive function and memory.
  • Reduces inflammation and strengthens immunity.
  • Aids in weight control by suppressing appetite.
  • Provides sustained energy, making it a great pre-workout snack.
  • Promotes healthier skin, providing hydration and UV protection.
  • Strengthens bones and supports better calcium absorption.
“Dark chocolate is really good for your heart and can prevent diabetes.”

Incorporating dark chocolate into your diet can lead to notable health improvements, making it both a delicious and smart choice.

item.title: Supercharge your turmeric milk: 12 add-ins for health benefits - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Supercharge your turmeric milk: 12 add-ins for health benefits

By Namita S. Kalla | December 30, 2024

Turmeric milk is a powerhouse of health benefits. Boost its healing potential with these 12 natural add-ins to maximize flavor.

  • Cinnamon: Comforting flavor that balances blood sugar levels and enhances antioxidants.
  • Ghee: Improves curcumin absorption and adds richness.
  • Cardamom: Aids digestion and detoxification while complementing turmeric.
  • Black pepper: Increases curcumin absorption and adds warmth.
  • Tulsi leaves: Offers herbal flavor and boosts immunity.
  • Star anise: Supports digestion and reduces inflammation.
  • Saffron: Luxurious flavor with mood-boosting properties.
  • Ginger powder: Intensifies warmth and supports digestion.
  • Honey: Natural sweetener that enhances antibacterial properties.
“Turmeric milk is a powerhouse of health benefits.”

Integrating these add-ins can significantly enhance the health benefits of turmeric milk, making it a delightful and nutritious beverage.

item.title: Ozone Therapy Promise for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury: Researchers - The Sentinel Assam
item.description:
Ozone Therapy Promise for Sepsis-Induced Lung Injury: Researchers

Publication Date: Not specified in the article Source: Sentinel Assam

Researchers at Nanjing Medical University report that medical ozone therapy is a promising treatment for sepsis-induced acute lung injury (ALI), which could significantly improve survival rates and lung function. This therapy targets neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs) that exacerbate lung injury.

  • Sepsis is a leading cause of ALI and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
  • The study published in the Journal of Biomedical Research indicates ozone therapy effectively clears NETs in mice models.
  • The research suggests ozone therapy could dramatically improve outcomes in critical care for sepsis patients.
  • If validated in human trials, ozone therapy could become a viable treatment for sepsis-induced lung injury.
"Our research demonstrates that medical ozone therapy could dramatically improve the management of sepsis-induced ALI," said Dr. Wen-Tao Liu, principal investigator.

This study represents an important step towards developing effective treatments for sepsis, potentially transforming patient care and survival rates.

item.title: 7 Healthy Juices to Boost Belly Fat Loss - OTV News
item.description:
7 Healthy Juices to Boost Belly Fat Loss

Date: Monday, 30 December 2024 | Source: Odisha TV

Tired of the same old weight-loss routine? Add a flavorful twist with these 7 healthy juices that support belly fat reduction.

  • Pomegranate Juice: Rich in antioxidants, helps reduce inflammation, supports heart health, & aids fat reduction when enjoyed in moderation.
  • Green Apple Juice: Low in sugar and high in fiber, regulates digestion, promotes fullness, & detoxifies the liver.
  • Carrot Juice: Supports vision and skin health, curbing unhealthy cravings with its natural sweetness.
  • Radish Juice: Helps detoxify the body, boost metabolism, & reduce water retention.
  • Green Juice: A mix of spinach, cucumber, & lemon, rich in iron and antioxidants.
  • Beetroot Juice: Improves blood flow and aids digestion, keeping you full longer.
  • Lemon-Ginger Green Juice: Supports detoxification and appetite control.

While they’re not magic solutions, these nutrient-packed drinks can give your weight-loss journey a refreshing boost.

item.title: Explained: Bird flu could be 2025's biggest health problems - NewsBytes
item.description:
Explained: Bird flu could be 2025's biggest health problem

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NewsBytes

As 2025 draws closer, global health experts are becoming increasingly alarmed by the rapid transmission of bird flu, particularly with a notable rise in cases in the United States.

  • The H5N1 strain has jumped from birds to other animals and humans.
  • Reported human mortality rate stands at 30% for bird flu infections.
  • Potential for a single mutation could enable human-to-human transmission.
  • Governments are preparing pandemic plans, including vaccine stockpiling.
  • Concerns exist regarding its impact on animal health and food supply chains.
"The situation highlights the importance of the 'one health' approach, which considers human, animal, and environmental health as interconnected entities."

The emergence and potential spread of H5N1 emphasize the need for vigilance and preparedness as we approach 2025, with significant consequences for both human and animal health.

item.title: 7 reasons to eat radish superfood in winter - Health shots
item.description:
7 Health Benefits Of Radish In Winter

Published Dec 30, 2024 by Healthshots

Radishes are not only crunchy and delicious but also packed with essential nutrients that offer various health benefits during the winter season.

  • Promotes digestion due to its high fiber content.
  • Supports weight loss as a low-calorie option that keeps you feeling full.
  • Lowers high blood pressure by maintaining fluid balance.
  • Boosts immunity with high vitamin C levels.
  • Contributes to skin health by fighting free radicals.

item.title: Want to lose belly fat in just 21 days? Check out these 5 dietitian-approved tips you can easily follow - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Want to shed belly fat in just 21 days? Check out these 5 dietitian-approved tips that’ll help you achieve a slimmer, healthier you with simple daily habits.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Struggling with stubborn belly fat? Clinical Nutritionist Aarbee shares five simple daily habits to help reduce it in just 21 days. These tips aim to tackle common misconceptions and create effective routines for weight loss.

Key Points:

  • 1. Practice time-restricted eating by fasting for 12-14 hours.
  • 2. Eat small, frequent meals to keep metabolism boosted.
  • 3. Prioritize your plate by eating veggies first.
  • 4. Ditch sugar and processed foods to aid weight loss.
  • 5. Stay hydrated and active with daily exercise.
"Are you ready to shed unwanted belly fat and reveal a slimmer, healthier you?" - Aarbee

This article is for informational purposes and not a substitute for professional medical advice.

item.title: Low Sperm Count? 5 Proven Lifestyle Changes and Fertility Solutions for Oligospermia - TheHealthSite
item.description:
Men's Sexual Health Problems: Low Sperm Count? 5 Proven Lifestyle Changes and Fertility Solutions for Oligospermia

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Health Site

Understanding and tackling low sperm count, known as oligospermia, is essential for those looking to conceive. The article outlines lifestyle changes and medical approaches to improve fertility.

Key Points:

  • Nutrition: Increase intake of zinc, folate, and omega-3 fatty acids.
  • Exercise and Stress Management: Engage in regular physical activity and stress-reducing practices like yoga.
  • Sleep: Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep to help regulate hormones.
  • Weight Management: Maintain a healthy weight to support sperm health.
  • Avoid Smoking and Alcohol: Both are detrimental to sperm motility and counts.
  • Heat Exposure: Minimize exposure to heat on the groin area.
  • Chemical Exposures: Limit contact with harmful chemicals.
  • Medical Treatments: Explore options like IUI and ICSI if lifestyle changes are insufficient.

Notable Quotes:

“Low sperm count does not have to be the definition of your journey to parenthood.”

Conclusion:

With mindful lifestyle changes and medical support, achieving parenthood is an attainable goal for men facing fertility challenges.

item.title: From 'gajar ka halwa' to hormonal disruptions: How overindulgence in high-sugar desserts lead to health condi - Indiatimes.com
item.description:
The Health Risks of Overindulging in High-Sugar Desserts

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indiatimes

As winter approaches, people crave traditional sweets like 'Gajar ka Halwa'. However, excessive consumption can lead to serious health issues such as obesity, diabetes, and hormonal imbalances.

  • High-sugar desserts can contribute to obesity and related health conditions.
  • Common ailments linked to overindulgence include diabetes, hypertension, and cardiovascular diseases.
  • Hormonal disruptions can occur due to excessive sugar intake, leading to issues like insulin resistance.
  • Dr. Aruna Mallya and Dr. Satish N highlight potential health risks, including premature childbirth and high cholesterol.
“Excess sugar consumption can lead to detrimental effects on one's health, more so because it causes weight gain and hormonal discrepancies.” - Dr. Satish N

With rising sweet consumption, awareness about its health impacts is crucial for better lifestyle choices.

item.description:
10 Vegetarian Ways to Increase Daily Protein Intake

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Protein is essential for muscle repair and general health, especially for vegans facing challenges in daily protein intake. This article discusses 10 vegetarian sources to help improve protein consumption.

  • Legumes: Includes lentils, chickpeas, and beans.
  • Tofu and Tempeh: Plant-based protein sources.
  • Quinoa: Complete protein with all essential amino acids.
  • Greek Yogurt: Higher protein content than regular yogurt.
  • Nuts and Seeds: Various options for snacks and smoothies.

  • Plant-based Protein Powders: Easy supplements for protein needs.
“If you are having trouble meeting your protein needs, plant-based protein powders can be an easy and effective way to supplement your intake.”

Incorporating these vegetarian sources can significantly help in achieving daily protein goals.

item.title: Bilateral primary vitreoretinal lymphoma masquerading as fungal endophthalmitis- a case report - Journal of Ophthalmic Inflammation and Infection
item.description:
Bilateral Primary Vitreoretinal Lymphoma Masquerading as Fungal Endophthalmitis - A Case Report

Published: 30 December 2024 | Source: Journal of Ophthalmic Inflammation and Infection, Volume 14, Article number 69

This article reports a case of bilateral primary vitreoretinal lymphoma (PVRL) that was initially suspected to be an infectious endophthalmitis in a patient with recent cataract surgery and COVID-19 history. The diagnosis was eventually confirmed through multimodal imaging and a sub retinal biopsy.

  • A 60-year-old male patient presented with vision loss post cataract surgery.
  • Clinical suspicion of endophthalmitis led to diagnostic vitrectomy, which returned negative microbiological results.
  • Multimodal imaging and biopsy confirmed PVRL, which was treated with intravitreal methotrexate.
  • Patient achieved remission after multiple injections.
“Vitritis with sub-RPE yellowish deposits may be mistaken for infectious endophthalmitis, especially in a patient with a history of intraocular surgery or immunosuppression.”

This case emphasizes the importance of considering PVRL in differential diagnosis, especially for middle-aged patients presenting with similar symptoms, highlighting how critical timely diagnosis and appropriate management can be for patient outcomes.

item.title: Malaysian diabetics face medicine shortage as slimming craze thins supply of Ozempic - asianews.network
item.description:
Ozempic Shortage in Malaysia: Slimming Craze Impacts Diabetics

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, PETALING JAYA

Malaysian Pharmacists Society president Amrahi Buang confirmed the shortage of Ozempic, a diabetes medication that has gained popularity as a weight-loss solution. The increased demand from non-diabetic individuals has led to a scarcity, impacting those who genuinely need the drug to manage their diabetes.

  1. Ozempic, a semaglutide injectable medication, helps manage blood sugar levels in adults with Type 2 diabetes.
  2. Pharmacists warn against misusing the drug for weight loss without medical supervision due to potential side effects like hypoglycemia.
  3. Distributors have started rationing supplies to ensure broader access.
  4. Side effects include nausea, diarrhoea, constipation, and vomiting, with potential long-term effects like gallbladder issues.
  5. Semaglutide should be used alongside lifestyle and dietary changes, with serious complications like pancreatitis being rare.
“There are many who are interested only in the drug’s weight loss potency, creating a huge demand and a shortage in the market.” – Amrahi Buang, Malaysian Pharmacists Society president

Conclusion: The global weight loss craze around Ozempic has led to a shortage in Malaysia, impacting diabetics who rely on the medication to manage their blood sugar levels. Pharmacists and medical professionals warn against misusing the drug without proper medical guidance.

item.title: 5 superfoods rich in Omega-3 fatty acids beyond fatty fish - Mint
item.description:
5 Superfoods Rich in Omega-3 Fatty Acids Beyond Fatty Fish

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Mint

Consuming two servings of fatty fish weekly can meet your daily requirement of Omega-3 fatty acids. But if you are not a fatty fish fan, we have alternatives for you.

  • Flaxseeds: Among the richest sources of omega-3 fatty acid alpha-linolenic acid (ALA).
  • Walnuts: Rich in Omega-3 fatty acids, fiber, and other beneficial compounds.
  • Chia Seeds: Highly nutritious seeds containing a considerable amount of Omega-3 fatty acids.
  • Oysters: Nutrient-dense shellfish providing a significant amount of Omega-3 fatty acids.
  • Soybeans: Rich in omega-6 and omega-3 fatty acids, reducing cardiovascular disease risk.
This article highlights alternatives to fatty fish for obtaining Omega-3 fatty acids.

Including these superfoods in your diet can help you meet your Omega-3 needs without consuming fish.

item.title: CDC Detects Bird Flu Mutation in Human, Amid New Infections in Cats - ScienceAlert
item.description:
CDC Detects Bird Flu Mutation in Human, Amid New Infections in Cats

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Agence France-Presse

The ongoing spread of bird flu in the United States has alarmed experts, especially with new infections reported in cats and a potential mutation of the virus in humans.

  • A sample from a critically ill patient in Louisiana shows signs of mutation that may enhance the virus's ability to infect humans.
  • The CDC reported 65 confirmed human cases of bird flu in 2024, with more potentially undetected.
  • An infected cat in Oregon died from contaminated raw pet food, raising concerns over transmission risks to humans.
  • The mutation in the human virus is believed to have occurred during replication in the ill patient, with no evidence of wider human transmission.
  • Experts caution that while mutations can help virus binding, they do not necessarily indicate increased transmissibility or severity.
"It's good to know we should be looking out for this, but it doesn't actually tell us, 'Oh, we're this much closer to a pandemic now.'" — Dr. Angela Rasmussen

Researchers are also monitoring infections in cats, as this could pose a risk for human transmission. Prompt attention is necessary to understand the implications of these developments.
